CatDescriptText: Robert "Bobby" Rivers, demolition employee, 39 Stuben Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 21, 1957, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think the city wage tax, which is one-half of one percent of your wage, is fair or unfair?" Answer reads: "I don't see why we have to pay all other taxes and then pay the city wage tax, also.  For that reason, I think that it is unfair."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert "Bobby" Rivers wearing plaid shirt, posed in front of brick building with Pittsburgh Post-Gazette newspaper hanging out of mail slot in door with "For Rent" sign
